subject: AI
title: When Not to Use LLMs
description: Tasks where traditional software is simply better.

hook.text: A startup uses GPT-4 to validate email addresses. It costs $0.01 per validation. A regex costs $0.00001. The LLM is 1,000x more expensive and less accurate.

buildup.text: Don't use LLMs for: deterministic tasks (validation, formatting), precise calculations, database queries, pattern matching, or anything with clearly defined rules.

discovery.text: The rule: if you can write the logic as a function that always gives the correct answer, use the function. LLMs are for tasks where the 'correct answer' is ambiguous or context-dependent.

twist.text: Hybrid is often best: use an LLM to understand the user's intent, then use traditional code to execute it. 'What does the user want?' â†’ LLM. 'Calculate the shipping cost' â†’ function.

climax.text: Match the tool to the task: LLMs for ambiguity and language, traditional code for precision and determinism. The best systems combine both.

punchline.text: Not everything needs an LLM. The best AI engineers know when to use a regex instead.
